com.linkedin.parseq

Interface Cancellable

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    ParTask<T>, Task<T>, Tuple2Task<T1,T2>, Tuple3Task<T1,T2,T3>, Tuple4Task<T1,T2,T3,T4>, Tuple5Task<T1,T2,T3,T4,T5>, Tuple6Task<T1,T2,T3,T4,T5,T6>, Tuple7Task<T1,T2,T3,T4,T5,T6,T7>, Tuple8Task<T1,T2,T3,T4,T5,T6,T7,T8>, Tuple9Task<T1,T2,T3,T4,T5,T6,T7,T8,T9>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ActionTask, AsyncCallableTask, BaseTask, CallableTask, Par2Task, Par3Task, Par4Task, Par5Task, Par6Task, Par7Task, Par8Task, Par9Task, Tuple2TaskDelegate, Tuple3TaskDelegate, Tuple4TaskDelegate, Tuple5TaskDelegate, Tuple6TaskDelegate, Tuple7TaskDelegate, Tuple8TaskDelegate, Tuple9TaskDelegate

    public interface Cancellable
    An object that can be cancelled with a reason.
    Author:
    Chris Pettitt (cpettitt@linkedin.com)

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean cancel(java.lang.Exception reason)
      Attempts to cancel the object with the given reason.

    • Method Detail

      • cancel

        boolean cancel(java.lang.Exception reason)
        Attempts to cancel the object with the given reason. Check the return value to determine if cancellation was successful. Subsequent calls to cancel will always return false.
        Parameters:
        reason - an Exception indicating why this object was cancelled
        Returns:
        true iff the object was successfully cancelled as a result of this invocation.
